result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devonte Lamont Giles

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Devonte Lamont Giles appeared by video.  Attorney Daniel Mcmurray appeared by video for Devonte Lamont Giles.  Attorney Mallory R Davis appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. For reasons stated on the record, defense counsel requests an adjourned plea and sentencing hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Devonte Lamont Giles in court with attorney Daniel Mcmurray.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel requests a plea and sentencing hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Devonte Lamont Giles in court with attorney Daniel Mcmurray.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Daniel Goodchild - MPD Police Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on 6/1/22 at 2:00 pm moved to 9:30 am. Parties notified via email.

Defendant Devonte Lamont Giles in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 29.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 04/29/2022@01:00pm
